pkgmetadata.longdescription: Robust Model-Based Clustering // Performs robust cluster analysis allowing for outliers and noise that cannot be fitted by any cluster. The data are modelled by a mixture of Gaussian distributions and a noise component, which is an improper uniform distribution covering the whole Euclidean space. Parameters are estimated by (pseudo) maximum likelihood. This is fitted by a EM-type algorithm. See Coretto and Hennig (2015) https://arxiv.org/abs/1406.0808, and Coretto and Hennig (2016) https://arxiv.org/abs/1309.6895.
